post.author: 김태희
post.content:
Recognized as one of Canada?s Top 100 Employers for 2008, Sierra Systems is an exciting, dynamic and growing professional services company. Founded in 1966, we provide management consulting, project implementation and managed services to an enviable list of clients in a wide range of industries including state, provincial and local government, health, justice, transportation, energy, financial services, and insurance.  We are proud to employ over 1,000 employees in 13 markets including: Austin, Calgary, Edmonton, Halifax, Los Angeles, Olympia, Ottawa, Regina, Seattle, Toronto, Vancouver, Victoria, Winnipeg and a development center in Romania. For more information, please visit www.sierrasystems.com.
Java Developer

As a member of the Systems Integration Practice, the Technical Consultant by virtue of their experience gained and their exposure to a variety of project areas, will act as a point of reference for C?ram-related technical implementation knowledge both internally and externally.  They represent ?seasoned? engineers who will have significant delivery responsibilities as part of a project implementation, and will typically be well-known and sought-after individuals headed for Senior Technical Consultant positions.  They will act as the point of contact on site for development-related questions and issues that arise which cannot be addressed by a technical consultant.  They will liaise closely with Senior Technical Consultants on design and development issues, and may act in the role of senior technical consultant for small projects or Proofs of Concepts.  They will typically be assigned to a single project at a time.

KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

To uphold the same professional standards and work ethic expected of all our Consultancy staff and to lead by example when working with less experienced staff
To act as a technical reference for C?ram-related development, testing and deployment knowledge, both internally to Associate Technical Consultants and other Technical Consultants, and externally to IS partner and Customer development staff
To work as part of a team with IS partners and/or customers to implement business requirements using the C?ram Framework in a timely, performance-centric and maintainable manner
To work closely with C?ram Software, IS partner and Customer Technical Architects to design specific functional areas of a customer?s requirements
To establish and maintain a positive working relationship with fellow employees, Partners and Customers, and to promote C?ram Software?s technical credibility as a capable and trusted partner.
PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

A minimum of three year's post-graduate experience and a diploma or degree in a computer-related discipline or equivalent computer-related technical experience is required
3 plus years Java programming experience or equivalent with Java certification.
Thorough knowledge and experience of working with Oracle or DB2 and SQL
Proficient in UML and J2EE
Familiar with & references design patterns
Experience with Unix and NT Operating systems
Good knowledge of Rational Rose
Knowledge of Websphere (including WSAD)
Good knowledge of all aspects of IT systems development
Ability to direct and motivate technical teams
Good interpersonal skills and situational awareness, with the ability to tactfully represent C?ram Software interests in dynamic customer environments
Willingness to travel up to 60-70% for first two years
Sierra Systems is an equal opportunity employer.

If you are interested in this opportunity and possess the required skills, please email your cover letter and resume to: 9823MH518@apply.maxhire.net
post.title: Java Developer
